content.description:
The coral species Acropora millepora is a marine animal that has a symbiotic relationship with algae species in the genus Symbiodinium. An increase in the concentration of dissolved <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in oceans has a negative impact on this relationship and the health of the coral species. Scientists investigated the effect of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations on the number of algae cells found in the coral (Figure 1) and on both the gross (total) and net rates of photosynthesis of those algae (Figure 2). The net rate of photosynthesis is equal to the gross rate of photosynthesis minus the rate of respiration by the algae.

Figure 1. Effect of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration on the number of algae per <math alttext="square centimeters" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>cm</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> of coral. Error bars represent <math alttext="plus or minus 2 S E sub x bar" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>±</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mtext>SE</mtext><mover accent="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover></msub></math>.

Figure 2. Average gross and net rates of photosynthesis in algae under various concentrations of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Error bars represent <math alttext="plus or minus 2 S E sub x bar" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>±</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mtext>SE</mtext><mover accent="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>¯</mo></mover></msub></math>.
content.question: Based on Figure 2, which of the following best supports the claim that <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration and photosynthetic productivity are inversely related?

choices.label: The net rate of photosynthesis is less than the gross rate of photosynthesis at the high concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Both the net and gross rates of photosynthesis at the high concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are lower than those at the low concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The net rate of photosynthesis at the low concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is lower than the gross rate of photosynthesis at the high concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The difference between net and gross rates of photosynthesis is greater at the low concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> than it is at the high concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Both the net and gross rates of photosynthesis at the high concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are lower than those at the low concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
